text.Prompt:
Conversation:
Karen: Steven, I need badly your help.
Jane: What's the matter?
Karen: My wife has found that I have an affair with my secretary, and now she is going to divorce me.
Jane: How could you cheat on your wife? You have been married for ten years.
Karen: Yes, I know I'm wrong. But I swear that the affair lasts only for two months. And I still love my wife. I couldn't live without her.
Jane: I will try my best to persuade her to reconsider the divorce. But are you sure that from now on you will be faithful to her forever?
Karen: Yes, I swear.

Now write a summary of the conversation:
text.Response A: In the conversation, Karen asks for Steven's help as her wife has found out about her affair with her secretary. Jane questions Karen's infidelity and reminds her of her ten-year marriage. Karen promises to be faithful to her wife and asks Jane to persuade her to reconsider the divorce. Jane agrees to help and asks if Karen is sure about her promise.
text.Response B: Karen's wife is going to divorce her. Karen is guilty of having an affair. Jane will try to persuade her wife to reconsider the divorce.
